basics.name: Jie-Ren (Jarron) Shih
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: As a security expert, network consultant, infrastructure builder with 5 years experience developer, Jie-Ren is experienced in developing secure enterprise software and building high scalable H/A product. Jie-Ren is also experienced in all kind of virtual cloud platform, hypervisor and infrastructure from AWS, Azure, vmware, docker to serverless.

Enhance QoS to SaaS service, making different level customer sharing resource in cloud.
Parsing network traffic in packet level, work as data engineer in network analysis product.

Implement software agent on major cloud service providers including Amazon EC2, Microsoft Azure and HP-Cloud

publications.name: Root Volume Encryption Mechanism in Para-virtualized Virtual Machine
publications.summary: The present invention is generally related to provide data protection. More particularly, the present invention is directed to achieve root volume encryption in a para-virtualized virtual machine.

publications.name: Securing M2M with Post-quantum Public-key Cryptography
publications.publisher: Emerging and Selected Topics in Circuits and Systems / IEEE Journal
publications.summary: We present an ASIC implementation of two post-quantum public-key cryptosystems (PKCs): NTRU-Encrypt and TTS. It represents a first step toward securing machine-to-machine (M2M) systems using strong, hardware-assisted PKC. In contrast to the conventional wisdom that PKC is too expensive for M2M sensors, it actually can lower the total cost of ownership because of cost savings in provision, deployment, operation, maintenance, and general management.

publications.name: MIFARE Classic: Practical Attacks and Defenses
publications.publisher: Chinese Cryptology and Information Security Association
publications.summary: MIFARE Classic is a proprietary contactless smart card technology widely used in public transportation ticketing systems of cities across the world. MIFARE Classic's cryptographic protection to the stored data has been reverse-engineered and broken in a recent series of papers. In this paper, we report our experience attacking a real MIFARE Classic system. Specifically, we have implemented a brute-force search using NVIDIA graphics cards to verify the claims in the literature. To our best knowledge, this is the first report in the literature of a practical long-range attack. These attacks disarm all cryptographic protection of MIFARE Classic, making it extremely difficult to secure transactions. Lastly, we take up the challenge and present our ideas how to defend against most attacks using practical mechanisms that do not require any hardware changes.

publications.name: A practical experience with RFID security
publications.publisher: Mobile Data Management: Systems, Services and Middleware, 2009 / IEEE
publications.summary: Radio-frequency identification (RFID) technologies allow remote identification as well as generic data access using radio waves. We capture and analyze the communication between a legitimate reader and an EasyCard using GNURadio, an open-source software-defined radio running on PC. We will share our experiences with EasyCard security and hopefully provide some insights into RFID security in practice.
